owl:AnnotationProperty.rdfs:label: temporal interpretation
owl:AnnotationProperty.obo:IAO_0000115: An assertion that holds between an OWL Object Property and a temporal interpretation that elucidates how OWL Class Axioms that use this property are to be interpreted in a temporal context.

owl:AnnotationProperty.rdfs:label: logical macro assertion
owl:AnnotationProperty.obo:IAO_0000115: An assertion that involves at least one OWL object that is intended to be expanded into one or more logical axioms. The logical expansion can yield axioms expressed using any formal logical system, including, but not limited to OWL2-DL.

owl:AnnotationProperty.rdfs:label: logical macro assertion on an object property
owl:AnnotationProperty.obo:IAO_0000115: Used to annotate object properties to describe a logical meta-property or characteristic of the object property.

owl:AnnotationProperty.rdfs:label: logical macro assertion on a property
owl:AnnotationProperty.obo:IAO_0000115: A logical macro assertion whose domain is an IRI for a property

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: characteristic of
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Note that this relation was previously called "inheres in", but was changed to be called "characteristic of" because BFO2 uses "inheres in" in a more restricted fashion. This relation differs from BFO2:inheres_in in two respects: (1) it does not impose a range constraint, and thus it allows qualities of processes, as well as of information entities, whereas BFO2 restricts inheres_in to only apply to independent continuants (2) it is declared functional, i.e. something can only be a characteristic of one thing.
owl:ObjectProperty.obo:IAO_0000115: a relation between a specifically dependent continuant (the characteristic) and any other entity (the bearer), in which the characteristic depends on the bearer for its existence.
owl:ObjectProperty.obo:IAO_0000112: this fragility is a characteristic of this vase
this red color is a characteristic of this apple

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: has characteristic
owl:ObjectProperty.obo:IAO_0000116: A bearer can have many dependents, and its dependents can exist for different periods of time, but none of its dependents can exist when the bearer does not exist.
owl:ObjectProperty.obo:IAO_0000112: this apple is bearer of this red color
this vase is bearer of this fragility

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: role of
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: This relation is modeled after the BFO relation of the same name which was in BFO2, but is used in a more restricted sense - specifically, we model this relation as functional (inherited from characteristic-of). Note that this relation is now removed from BFO2020.
owl:ObjectProperty.obo:IAO_0000116: A role inheres in its bearer at all times for which the role exists, however the role need not be realized at all the times that the role exists.
owl:ObjectProperty.obo:IAO_0000115: a relation between a role and an independent continuant (the bearer), in which the role specifically depends on the bearer for its existence
owl:ObjectProperty.obo:IAO_0000112: this investigator role is a role of this person

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: has role
owl:ObjectProperty.obo:IAO_0000116: A bearer can have many roles, and its roles can exist for different periods of time, but none of its roles can exist when the bearer does not exist. A role need not be realized at all the times that the role exists.
owl:ObjectProperty.obo:IAO_0000115: a relation between an independent continuant (the bearer) and a role, in which the role specifically depends on the bearer for its existence
owl:ObjectProperty.obo:IAO_0000112: this person has role this investigator role (more colloquially: this person has this role of investigator)
